headline: Ahmed Yousef, former Hamas official: 'We have lost everything, armed struggle has failed'
subhead: A former senior official of Hamas, with whom he has since broken ties, Yousef offers a bleak assessment of two years of war in the Palestinian enclave. Now living in a tent in Gaza, he voices rare criticism among Islamist circles toward Yahya Sinwar, the militant behind the October 7 attack, which he calls a 'fatal mistake.'

headline: Iran's participation in BRICS+ naval drills against South Africa's wishes causes confusion
French former minster Jack Lang summoned to explain Epstein links
'The Kurds had Western support, especially from the US. That support has now been withdrawn'
subhead: The agreement signed by Syrian President Ahmed al-Sharaa brings an end to the experiment of Rojava, an autonomous region in the northeast of the country. The United States gave its approval for dismantling this Kurdish stronghold and its military wing, both of which it had previously protected, explains Alain Frachon in his column for Le Monde.

headline: Kimi Onoda, Japan's young minister likened to 'Joan of Arc,' courts the conservative electorate
subhead: Kimi Onoda, the new darling of Japanese conservatives, has won over the public with her fighting spirit. A senator and government minister, the video game enthusiast in her 40s now holds a central post in the Takaichi administration and is leveraging her popularity for her party ahead of snap elections scheduled for February 8.

headline: Pretzels and Käseküeche: The comforting treasures of Alsatian cuisine
subhead: 'Homemade!' Léo Pajon, our food journalist, visits your kitchens. At Margaux Albrecht's home on the edge of Alsace, he learns how to make the famous savory pastries and a delicious cheesecake.

headline: How Marine Le Pen changed her defense strategy
subhead: The far-right leader on trial for embezzlement has acknowledged that she may have unintentionally committed an offense, but argued that the European Parliament had never raised any red flags. She is trying to avoid a sentence that would prevent her from running for president.

headline: Trump launches website under his name to buy drugs at reduced prices
Suspected former member of the Kosovo Liberation Army arrested for war crimes
Secondhand market booms, challenging luxury industry
Michelangelo drawing sells for record $27.2 million at New York auction
Epstein affair: Former Norwegian prime minister Thorbjørn Jagland under investigation for corruption
Louvre heist: Empress Eugénie's damaged crown will be restored, museum vows
Foreign language learning holds strong against the AI wave
Japan to restart world's biggest nuclear plant
Lore Baudrit, captain of France's Olympic women's hockey team: 'We train like pros, but don't get paid'
This French territory off the coast of Canada has 'no clear sense of worry' over Trump
European intelligence services adapt to the upheavals of the Trump era
Epstein's correspondence reveals links to French public figures
'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
subhead: The Canadian prime minister has called for an alliance of middle powers to stand up to the world's great powers. This is a compelling idea, and one that Europe has been pursuing for 60 years, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

headline: The 'Washington Post,' legendary American daily, is shaken by mass layoffs
subhead: The newspaper that revealed the Watergate scandal is dismissing 300 of its 800 journalists, including many foreign correspondents. The decision triggered a wave of emotion and anger both inside and outside the newsroom, directed particularly at the owner, billionaire Jeff Bezos.

headline: Democracy is fading in Africa as the world looks away
subhead: While global powers covet Africa's natural resources, they have paid little attention to the wave of coups that have swept the continent in recent years.

headline: The unresolved contradictions of the Winter Olympics
'Not only is Trump not crazy, but he is dangerous': Historian Laure Murat salutes Minneapolis 'lesson in democracy'
'The US always promises to extract itself from Middle Eastern quagmires while continuing to get stuck knee-deep'
